Reviews.Title: “The worst ever...”
Reviews.Author: maryam f
Reviews.Content: it's 2star motel... it's not standard hotel... i hate the hotel and the street of it was full of poor people .. i scared whenever i walked in the street.. never go there

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Amin M
Reviews.Content: Poor Breakfast , rooms are small , if you looking for a Cheap place to stay and near the center of Istanbul you can go , i used the hotel just for bed i'm out at 9 and back at 1 or 2am but don't expect more not more than a 3 stars by any way

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever.....”
Reviews.Author: marialena_an
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my boyfriend for three "scary" nights!!! The room was small, dirty, noisy and uncomfortable. Breakfast was poor and served in a very small area. The staff was unfriedly, speaking only basic english. The only good thing was the location.... I wouldn't recommende it to anyone...even to my enemies!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrific”
Reviews.Author: nanoukaki
Reviews.Content: OMG! Let me begin by saying that it is definitely NOT a four-star hotel. Do not be fooled by the rating. One-star maybe... The breakfast has a limited range of choices and unless you wake up at seven be ready to eat cold omelette or sausage. I mean they don' t even offer filter coffee!!! The rooms are pretty spacious but , apart from that I dont see the point in paying to stay in an old , not properly cleaned room with paper-thin walls and terrible matresses. The view however is great. I' ll give them that. Plus there is wi-fi connection. Do they even have cleaning ladies? Still wondering. Overall, if nice view and convenient location do not not cover your idea of a nice stay in a place DO NOT BOOK A ROOM THERE.

Reviews.Title: “unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: nikoletta p
Reviews.Content: The room was unacceptable!Very dirty,old furnitures,noisy and it smelled bad,as the entire hotel.The installations of lockers room and swimming-pool was inadequately and unsuitable for operation.The breakfast was relatively good and the location of hotel was near in the centre. Generally the worst hotel that I have ever gone!

Reviews.Title: “one star hotel, won't come back”
Reviews.Author: mhj02
Reviews.Content: the hotel is not clean, room smell bad, too noise from neighboring rooms, very cheap breakfast with unedible tea, and always crowded and chaotic. However, most tenants are families from eygpt and iraq, so lot of kids and babies. If you managed to book this hotel, DO NOT drink or eat any thing placed in the fridge, i've been charged with 99TL, yet no alcohol used. I was disappointed and frustrated with this hotel, and won't come back.

Reviews.Title: “Un-satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed6000
Reviews.Content: I was in Euro plaza last week, i don't recommend it to anyone, the room is very small and tight, & poor furniture. Over all it is not a 4 stars level, doesn't deserve more than 3 stars

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good Location”
Reviews.Author: Farab22
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my friend in this hotel for 7 nights. on our arrival it just took 3 hours till check in, and we left our baggages in the Loby, went out exploring Istiklal Street. My room was clean with a nice view to a local and green alley. The staff were nice and eager to help My friend and I each had a single room The location was good, 3 minute walking to Istiklal Street and 15 minutes to Taxim square, 15 minutes to Galata Tower and 15 minute to Bosphorus. there is a bus station just by the hotel and you can take Dolmush (small vans) to go to Aksaray. Just a few things to remember: 1- in each room there is a Safe ( I didn't find this option before my travel on Internet) 2- the hotel do not provide you with slippers, so take your slipper and tootpaste. 3- Internet and pool is free of charge, but for Masage and Sauna and minibar you should pay in check out 4- Breakfast saloon is small compared to the numbers of guests. it was always crowded 5- while visiting Forums and historical places you have to cross security gates, which affects your intelligent key card of your rooms in hotel. sometimes you should ask the reception to renew your card. for a medium budget I think europlaza is a considerable option. I may use this hotel for my next trips.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: likos79
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife Stayed at Europlaza for 3 days after searching for a budget hotel at Taxim area. The view of the hotel is excellent unlike the other 4* hotels at Taxim area.Rooms are a little bit small but clean and the staff very polite and helpful. If it was renovated would be one of the best 4* hotels.The breakfast buffet was rich and with large variety. I would definitely suggested if you like a clean and economic hotel at Taxim area.

Reviews.Title: “unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: Melinda54
Reviews.Content: When I first saw that hotel I thought it to be ugly,when I got inside I was disappointed by the plastic flowers. The view though was great. My room was very dirty, the maid was coming but didn't clean it she just changed towels and sometimes sheets. If they cleaned it Europlaza would be a very good hotel and it is such a petty that is located in Istanbul one of the cleanest cities ever.

Reviews.Title: “Old 4star Hotel which needs to be reviewed again”
Reviews.Author: SaraGhavam1979
Reviews.Content: you could see the leakage of Toilet and other pipelines together with the slightly unpleasant smell both from the bathroom and bedsheets. Breakfast was Ok but not so perfect and there is a beatiful balkony which has a great view of Istanbul for getting seated but rooms are quit poor! you can even walk to the city center as hotel is quit close to there. if you have no choice but going there, please make sure that room would have openable windows.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience ever....not even a 1 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: honestreview11
Reviews.Content: where to start...6 out of 12 floors are under ground, very smelly rooms and corridors, very tiny rooms, the Ac is not working, has dirty toilets, has such a small bed that your feet will be hanging out of the bed, no privacy what so ever (you will be hearing everything that goes on in the next room even if they were whispering), cheap breakfast buffet, and after all that the staff is rude and unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “smelling room”
Reviews.Author: teo_maria
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Europlaza 3 nights,first they make a mistake with rooms an we have to change. then when we get in our room it was smelling awfull! like they never open the windows or the door. we didn't like the breakfast. our room have a magestic view at Vosporus but in the middle of our room there was a huge pillar and avoid us to move!!! and last the free wifi internet was locked!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel, not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Xylola
Reviews.Content: this hotel is so far from Taksim square and i was expected to stay in a room showing the poshpour view but they didn't want to change the room for me. Ac was bad, recipient man was very aggressive. breakfast quiet low in quality. I don't like it at all.

Reviews.Title: “An adequate 3 star hotel, not close to tourist attractions.”
Reviews.Author: BradWPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Euro Plaza Hotel in Istanbul for 5 nights in early August, for a mixture of business and leisure time. The staff made a reasonable effort to be helpful, but were quite pressured as the hotel seems to get most of its business through package tours from Russia and Iran, so guests arrive in large numbers. The rooms were average, but comfortable enough and reasonably clean. Breakfasts were quite adequate. The location means that you have a decent hike or a taxi ride to any attractions (though Esteglal St and its restaurants are only a 10 min walk away). The hotel should be reclassified as 3-star, rather than the current 4, then guests would know what they should be paying, and not set their expectations too high.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on yr expectations”
Reviews.Author: Samah-Abu-Ghazaleh
Reviews.Content: Well, there is nothing good or bad, it depends on what you want, i personally didn't want to freeze my money in a 5-star hotel .. this hotel in particular had (Please check pictures i've taken): 1. A fantastic panorama view unlike other hotels in Taksim area, 2. The breakfast was good with varieties of cheese, cakes, eggs .. etc with pleasant view over Marmara Sea. 3. The room size was big enough, the TV is small but whatever size it comes with, you can still watch the news. We had a problem with the A/C so make sure it functions well if you go there in summer. 4. Oh, and the wireless internet connection was great!

Reviews.Title: “keep away”
Reviews.Author: MickeyHacohen
Reviews.Content: very poor maitenance. unpleasent atmosphire. don,t book it.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my God !!!!! avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SASO_11
Reviews.Content: If i spent my life imaginning the worst 4-star hotel, I'll fail to imagine this one... it dosen't even deserve to be rated, 100 euros per night for the following: dirty rooms, & toilets, with very old furniture and noisy location on the main street, almost dead A/C.rude staff poorly understand english, breakfast is less than basic, the room tv is portable, it's only 3'' . the exterior is completley dissrent than the interior, it's 15 minutes walking from taksim... you can find a much better offers nearby

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmadGharaibeh
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and quite, our room view was fantastic, where we can see the boshphores, the room was clean and tidy, we stayed there for 4 nights, the staff where friendly, the AC was not that good and you can smell cigarettes throw the ventilation windows! the breakfast was good and has good varieties. and the best thing in the hotel is the location of it, you can reach the Istiklal street in 10 minutes walking.

Reviews.Title: “what a horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: DubaiSaroja
Reviews.Content: i arrived to the hotel night time and i had to the room 3 times and didnt get a decent one.... we had to clean the toilet before using it... the pillows covers where dirty... and the AC was not working so i had to open the window and hear all the noises from outside to be ale to sleep.... what a wast of money to stay in that hotel

Reviews.Title: “terrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tina049
Reviews.Content: if you want to relax and not to catch any disease please don;t you ever visit this hotel! dirty noisy old etc....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoyzoy_7_
Reviews.Content: i have been there and stayed there for 4 days ... it was a school trip(school from Thessaloniki in Greece)! everything was great... clean hotel, comfortable and nice rooms... polite and hot staff!!! The only problem was that the window in my room couldn't close and the room was a bit cold at night.. but for sure if i ever come to Istanbul again i will prefer your hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: eminslc
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 days there, and liked very much. Hotel stuff are polite and hotel is not very expensive. I asked them if I can put my baggage for 3 days before to stay in hotel and they accepted.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious Hotel not up to it's Architecture”
Reviews.Author: zolo
Reviews.Content: Without knowing any of this property's history, I would guess that it was originally built with aspirations of becoming a first class hotel. It commands a nice figure, looking tres chic with panoramic views of the Golden Horn. Unfortunately the hotel cannot overcome the tawdry surroundings that the street offer, which according to previous reviews were there for some time. One cannot help feel that the hotel started with a grand ribbon-cutting but has been growing moldy ever since. We stayed here for three days in two rooms as our time in Istanbul bookended a Turkish tour we were on. A lot of the amenities simply did not work, such as the TV or the earlier lauded room safes. Add the noise factor either from the street or from the busloads of people coming and going at strange hours and you are in for an uncomfortable night. The breakfast is pretty ordinary. The hotel is in Beyoglu neighbourhood, a few blocks away from Isitikal Cadessi. However next time I would find something smaller in Sultanahmet. Istanbul is a wonderful destination with most sites within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disspionted”
Reviews.Author: carny51
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very undisireable area, the taxim is within walking distance - but we found the Taxim expensive, dirty and and not true istanbul - it is a taxi ride to anything of interest and the road it is on is full of transvestites standing around waiting for business - the hotel itself is very dirty - the swimming pool smells bad and the jacuzzi doesnt work properly (and seems to be set at a very high temperature). The sauna is nice although there is seperate for men and women.The shower head in our room did not fit into holder and so you need to hold it in one hand.The rooms are very small and our room was damp and the lamp shades flea bitten.The prices in the hotel were terrible - alot more than you would expect to pay in an english hotel eg the cans of coke in the mini bar were 5. 5 million (or ?2.50) and the turkish drinks like EFES were 6 million (or ?2.90) these were small - the large were only about 1.5 million in the shop around the corner.The bar prices were equally as bad, as was the restaurant.The breakfast was very non - disireable first thing in the morning - tables were full of crumbs and stains (the breakfast was meant to be free) and if you wanted orange juice you had to pay about ?1.50 otherwise you was limited to blackcurrent cordial. There were omellettes at breakfast but again this was charged at about ?2.50.There was only one good thing about the Euro Plaza and that was that it had free electronic safes in the rooms.All in all we were unhappy and we were moved to SUltanahmet area of Istanbul where we were 100 times more happy.

HotelInfo.Name: Allstar Euro Plaza Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Tarlabasi Bulvari 292 | Tepebasi, Istanbul 80070, Turkey
